instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook A2289 820-01897-06 M1  Dead
threads.message:
This Mabook  Macbook A2289 820-01897-06 M1  came in dead  after severe water damaged ,  when Connect my amp meter I can see that  my 20v DC is ok and pulling 11Watts and 10.5 amps and stuck there , Fan spins  but no boot , Can i please get some help ? 

Thank you very much .

threads.title: Macbook A2289 820-01897-06 M1  Dead
threads.message:
Isn't your board 820-01987?

Did you try DFU mode?
Was the board cleaned and corroded components replaced?

threads.title: Macbook A2289 820-01897-06 M1  Dead
threads.message: correct my mistake my board is  820-01987, I have not tried DFU mode yet , I spotted some corroded areas including the fan connector was gone and i rebuilt it , but  all the other places were fine and no shorts found, but i realize that CPU gets  hot .

threads.title: Macbook A2289 820-01897-06 M1  Dead
threads.message: This isn't an M1 board. This is Intel. Also you aren't pulling 10 amps. Post voltage on L7210.

threads.title: Macbook A2289 820-01897-06 M1  Dead
threads.message: L7210 is giving me 0.847 V on both sides.

threads.title: Macbook A2289 820-01897-06 M1  Dead
threads.message:
CPU core sould drop to aprox 0.6V when boots.
I suppose more damage caused by liquid spill.

threads.title: Macbook A2289 820-01897-06 M1  Dead
threads.message:
Ok , does that mean that CPU  is my issue , also according to your experience  should i review other areas for more corrosion ? 

Thank you very much .

threads.title: Macbook A2289 820-01897-06 M1  Dead
threads.message:
Can be CPU, or accumulated crap under it, or other BGA chip.
A simple corroded resistor can be also enough to block the board.

Did you try DFU at least?

threads.title: Macbook A2289 820-01897-06 M1  Dead
threads.message:
No, I have not yet tried the DFU mode , Would you please provide me with the combination keys to get it into DFU mode ? 

Thank you .

I will also review the resistors to see if any of them is corroded.

threads.title: Macbook A2289 820-01897-06 M1  Dead
threads.message: Thank you for the informations , i have tried to to get the device in DFU but was not succeded , i wanted to add a short preview video to show you the reaction on the AMP meter , i have added a clear picture . Thats where the device stuck on .

threads.title: Macbook A2289 820-01897-06 M1  Dead
threads.message:
Did you exactly follow all the steps in the DFU tutorial?
You can force it with SE032 pads.
